FuncDef: The patch load command loads a matching patch in the patch package to the current system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the storage path and file name of a patch package. The path name is an absolute path name or a relative path name.
The value is a string of 5 to 127 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value of the patch name is a string of 5 to 63 characters.

Runs a patch after the patch is loaded.
-

Examples: Info: Operating, please wait for a moment...
* Warning: Perform the following operations to deal with the cold patch.   *
Info: Succeeded in running the patch.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before loading a patch, the system resolves the patch package to check the validity of patch files and obtain the attributes of patch files.
When loading a patch to the current system, the system searches the patch package for a matching patch file according to the attributes of the patch file.
If a matching patch file is found in the patch package, the system loads the patch.If no matching patch file is found in the patch package, the system does not load the patch.

Prerequisites
The desired patch file has been uploaded to the main control board of the device.
Configuration Impact
After the patch load command is run, the system loads all types of patches in the patch package.
If the parameter run is used in the patch load command, the system runs the patch file after loading it.

Precautions
If a patch operation is performed when the CPU or memory usage is too high, risks may exist.
The device is reset before a cold patch takes effect.
This command applies only to the admin VS but takes effect on all VSs.
